intro: [WRONG START] Hieracius nigrescens subsp. reichartense, commonly known as the Reichart's hawkweed, is a perennial herb native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and flowering heads. The plant produces yellow to orange composite flowers, which are typical of the daisy family. It thrives in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and roadsides. Its subspecific classification highlights its distinct morphological and genetic traits compared to other members of the Hieracium species.
